verbose_text: To better understand the changes in BMP receptors and NF-kappaB signaling in IELs following I/R, flow cytometry was performed and it demonstrated that the expression of BMPRIA, BMPRIB and phosphorylated NF-kappaB increased following I/R (BMPRIA, 12.66 +/-0.91%; BMPRIB, 16.70 +/-2.22%; and p-NF-kappaB, 8.56 +/-2.87%), as shown in XREF_FIG.
evidence: BMPRIB and phosphorylated NF-kappaB increased following I/R (BMPRIA, 12.66+/-0.91%; BMPRIB, 16.70+/-2.22%; and p-NF-kappaB
